meanings.definition: To convert (a liquid) into a fine spray or mist.
meanings.sent1: I am nebulizing the medicine for my cough.
meanings.sent2: The doctor is nebulizing the saline solution for the patient.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the nebulizing machine, creating a misty mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to nebulize into a cloud of confusion in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The nebulizing process turned the liquid into a magical mist before my eyes.

meanings.sent1: The nurse is nebulizing the asthma patient in the hospital.
meanings.sent2: I will nebulize the medication for my allergies later.
meanings.sent3: The superhero nebulized the villain with a special mist to weaken him.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness nebulized the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: Nebulizing the solution helped clear the congestion in my chest quickly.

meanings.definition: The process of converting a liquid into a fine spray or mist.
meanings.sent1: The nebulizing of the perfume created a lovely scent in the room.
meanings.sent2: I watched the nebulizing of the cleaning solution with fascination.
meanings.sent3: The nebulizing of the water fountain made it look like a mini waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The nebulizing of emotions in the movie scene added depth to the story.
meanings.sent5: The nebulizing of the paint transformed the room into a colorful paradise.
